name: Abbie Reinsma
text: Amy McDaniel with Dewdrops Photography is in a league of her own.  Visiting her newer studio in Olympia, WA is the best decision we could have made.  Our daughter had spent some time in the NICU and we couldn't get photo's taken until 7 weeks.  I was a little bit nervous but upon arrival Amy immediately put us at ease.  She is extremely kind and professional.  With an extensive array of props/colors she soothed our baby girl and captured brilliant moments that we will cherish forever.  You will not be disappointed!  I have not stopped raving to my friends and family and hope that she is flooded with success in Olympia.  Definitely worth every penny-they grow so fast!

name: Kati Thomas
text: Amy was amazing she did a really great job even when my little girl got a little bit fussy she is amazing and she has such a way with newborns

resp.text: She is beautiful and I'm so honored that you allowed me to capture her at this stage of her life!

name: Samantha Andrews
text: Amy is incredible! We drove from Atlanta just to see her. I have followed and admired her work for years now, and when my daughter was born I knew I wanted Amy to photograph her. We arrived and Amy made us feel comfortable and at home. My daughter was fussy of course due to the long car ride, but Amy patiently soothed and comforted her and made sure she got plenty of set ups and poses. She had the studio set up so that we could get multiple props and colors in so that we have plenty of pictures to choose from. I am so glad we made the trip to Auburn— the whole experience was well worth it! Not only is her work incredible as you can see online, but the overall experience was awesome and I highly recommend hiring Amy. You will not be disappointed!

resp.text: Thank you so much! It was great to meet you and your sweet girl!

name: tawyna evans
text: Amy has always been my newborn photographer crush. I too am a newborn photographer and always dreamed of doing an in person workshop. When I found out she was coming to a town near me I jumped on the opportunity. SHE DID NOT DISAPPOINT! The workshop was phenomenal and my work was taken to the next level. She is a natural teacher and I promise if you do a workshop you will not be disappointed!

resp.text: Thank you so much! It was so great to meet you!

name: Jennifer Traylor
text:
I have been a part of many Dewdrops sessions and every session has been planned out with utmost care, wonderful props, custom made headbands, outfits, etc. She is both professional and extremely pleasant and fun. Babies LOVE her! She just has an incredibly special way with babies and adults as well.
Her images both on her social media, as well as her online proofing galleries, are exceptional. HIGHLY RECOMMEND to all my friends, family, and everyone else. She does not disappoint.

As for her mentoring classes and workshops, she is thorough, professional, fun, funny, and offers an immense wealth of knowledge both during the training and as a follow up in her online mentoring group that she generously shares in!

name: Rebecca Stoltz
text: Hands down the best newborn photographer you can find!  Amy has done a handful of sessions for our family from a one year old session to two newborn sessions over 8 years.  We absolutely love her work.  Amy doesn’t do the same repetitive props for her sessions.  She has incredible experience and her portfolio speaks for itself.  When your husband is even excited about the session, you know it is going to be good! The amount of props, wraps, etc, Amy had our first session blew me away.  Babies don’t stay newborns long and these images are something we will cherish for decades to come. I would pay for newborn photography over and over; hiring Amy each time.  I am so thankful she captured two of my three babies. I only wish I had found her sooner for my oldest!

resp.text: Thank you so much!

name: Kristin Dabbs
text: Excellent! This is my second time using Dewdrops Photography for newborn pictures and I haven't been disappointed yet! 100% worth every penny!

name: Angela Moss
text: Dewdrops Photography is the best photographer I've seen thus far. Her creativity is out of this world and her props are absolutely stunning. I will always recommend Dewdrops to anyone whether for newborn photos or family photos! Such great work

resp.text: Thank you so much!

name: Shirah A
text:
My wife and I definitely enjoyed the photoshoot Amy did for our 1 year old daughter. She was professional, friendly, and knew exactly how to make our daughter smile. We love our pictures. Our families are fighting over pictures right now!

Thanks again Amy! We will see you soon.

-Shi, Ty, and Baby J ❤️

resp.text: Thank you so much! I truly enjoyed meeting you and your family!

name: Hayley Benson
text:
First of all, have you seen the pictures? What else is there to say, really? They're so sweet I have to clench my teeth every time Amy makes a FB post.
We did newborn photos when I was 10 days post partum, and she took so much care to make sure I was comfortable in every pose. My fresh c-section appreciated it.
The real actual Santa Claus comes to the studio for a couple days every Fall bc Amy's on the Nice list. I actually cried when I got the finished images, and I'm pretty sure there was magic involved.
She's got props and precious outfits for days. Just bring a clean baby, and stand back while she does her thing.
Also, have you seen the pictures??

resp.text: Awwww! You’re the best! Thank you so much!

name: Melanie Resch
text: Seriously the best newborn photographer in the country.  She is truly gifted at what she does and her passion and creativity show in all of her work.

name: Fatima Gilbert
text:
I would NOT recommend DewDrop Photography.  Amy McDaniel was supposedly a great children photographer.  WRONG!!  She had no creativity, no patience, no cute props, she offered nothing!!  The pictures were ok at best, absolutely nothing special, nothing a phone camera could not have captured.

We were told, as per her contract, that proofs would be sent in one week and then final selections in one week.  NO!  We had to contact her numerous times after weeks.  We never got our final pictures.  Eight pictures!!!  We got an entire wedding album in two weeks!!  So after three weeks we got a refund.

Amy McDaniel is extremely unprofessional, rude, and as I stated the pictures were nothing special.  She ruined our sons first photography experience.

I would NOT recommend you use Amy McDaniel at Dew Drop  photography!!!!!  You will be disappointed.

resp.text: This review is completely false. Client brought in two dogs to be photographed with her 1 year old. I was assured both dogs were under strict voice command but they weren't. We spent two hours over two days to try to get a photograph of their baby and dogs. (Session is normally 30 minutes so patience wasn't the problem.) I understand how important pets are as we have three dogs at home and we love them. I bent over backwards for this session and even added a bubble bath at the end. My studio is packed with props and outfits for babies but creativity is challenging when you spend the entire session trying to get dogs to sit. She mentions a contract but she never received a contract so I'm not sure where that is coming from. I explained the timeline to her in person and that I am visiting my parents in Washington State while my mother has a tumor from her breast removed. Her images were going to be two days later than the verbal timeline but she didn't care. I would hope that people could show a little more compassion during this time but there is no pleasing this client. I have enjoyed over a decade with amazing and repeat clients who have been an absolute pleasure to work with but I felt it was important to reply with the truth. Client was refunded immediately after realizing there was nothing that would make her happy.

name: Lauren Kelly
text: I have admired Amy’s work for quite some time and I have been fortunate enough to attend 2 workshops of hers to date, and another later this year.  Seeing her in action is very inspiring!  She takes such care in handling new little babies and pays attention to every tiny detail—from posing to set design. She is truly the baby whisperer! (And that is the newborn session aspect of it. As a workshop attendee myself,  she is wonderful at explaining things as she goes and WHY she uses the techniques that she does.)

The way she handles the babies and the parents is so professional, sweet & caring. Her teaching ability is commendable as well. She is always answering questions even though the workshop was months ago- there's no extra fee for that help. I cannot wait to work with her again next summer!

Amy Pearsall McDaniel

Amys brings her wealth of newborn  knowledge,  experience and safety training to a new level. Covering each pose piece by piece.

Krystals unique approach to posing families allows you to seamlessly and effortlessly capture those real life personalities with out the pressure of being in front of a photographer

I walked away feeling inspired and refueled- my recent loss of passion has a new spark.

Both Krystal And Amy are extremely informative and their method of delivery was easy to receive from all attendees at every experience level.

name: Lori Booth

name: Juliana Rodrigues
text: I attended to Amy’s newborn photography workshop and it was life changing ! I learned so much , my confidence improved tremendously! This was one of the best investments I make in my business!

name: Karl Antoine
text: This individual is not professional at all. I contacted her over two months before my baby would arrive, to see if scheduling would work for a newborn shoot. She responded with an email of her package pricing and the services provided. My wife and I felt we could work with her, so I replied letting her know the package we wanted, and if she would be able to also do the maternity shoot for my wife. I made attempts to contact her via phone for a conversation to fully understand her process, and communicate what we were looking for. Getting her on the phone was nearly impossible. The failed attempts were due to her workshop held in Canada in late April. I made additional calls, with no success, and no capability of leaving a voicemail, as hers was full. My only other option was to send another email. She replied a few days later in between her workshop with one available day in May for the maternity shoot. She did say it would be difficult to fit my wife in for the maternity, but would try. My wife and I initially agreed to the date, and Amy sent an email with an invoice. Throughout this whole interaction, no phone conversation took place. I paid for the maternity shoot in full since the date was about 3 weeks out, and placed a deposit for the newborn shoot. I did this to make sure we could get on her calendar, despite still not talking with her. After I paid her, I still was not able to make contact to coordinate the maternity shoot. I also made her aware that we live in the metro Atlanta area, and would be driving to her. Due to the lack of communication, and not being familiar with the Auburn area, her studio, caused my wife and I to cancel. Again, not being able to get her on the phone to communicate this, I texted her to about a week and a half prior to the maternity shoot to cancel. I asked if the balance I paid could be moved to a larger newborn package, and she was pleased to do so. Fast forward to June 14, I contacted her to let her know the exact date our baby would be born, understanding that we would finally have a phone conversation. Still no success on that front. She responds with one date for the newborn shoot that did not work for my wife and I. I then asked if she would be able to do the shoot on a different day, and that too did not work for my wife and I. It wasn't until I sent her an email letting her know I wanted to cancel everything was when we finally spoke on the phone. I let her know I wanted all my money back and explained the reasons why. She offered no apology, no option, only another date, that still did not work. Her only response was to take it up with PayPal, so I did. I never write reviews of this length, or do review at all, but Amy brought this on herself. She texted me 3:50 AM, then again at 5:03 AM, clearly upset about the outcome of the PayPal dispute. If she did not decide to harass me, and move on, I would have done so as well. There is always 2 sides to a story. I disclosed everything to PayPal, also citing that I was not provided any contract, offered three dates, that did not work, and minimal communication from Amy. Writing all of this took time I did not want to give do so, but having worked with multiple business owners and professionals from different industries, Amy lacks attributes of a business owner. Primarily that of being ethical. Doing research provided me insight on what Amy's true passion is, and that is holding workshops. He lack of availability is due to the abundance of workshops she is scheduled to hold. If she disclosed this material information to me from the very beginning, I would have made the decision to work with her or not. There are so many workshops planned for the remainder of this year, as well as 2020, both domestically and internationally. It's also clear that workshops are her passion, when 100% of her positive 5 star reviews are from workshop attendees. Amy I truly hope you use this as a learning opportunity to improve your business model, and just stick to doing workshops, or fully disclose how you work.

resp.text: This gentleman sent red flags from the very beginning so having a phone conversation with him was definitely out of the question. I knew I needed a paper trail to have proof of our conversations via email and text messages. I’m so grateful I have the documents that I’ve sent to PayPal. I was more than professional and when he cancelled his maternity session I was more than happy to let him transfer that money to his newborn session. This is after sending pictures of all of my maternity gowns and giving him several dates for his maternity session. They simply didn’t want to make the trip to Auburn. I was more than flexible by giving him 3 available dates for the newborn session. Baby hasn’t even been born yet! His assumptions about workshops are false. My family will be on vacation on the exact date that he wanted which is why I always advise my clients that we both remain flexible because we never know when babies are going to make their appearance into the world. My passions are my own family and newborn photography.  Workshops are how I put food on the table. I’m so glad I didn’t speak to this guy in the beginning because I wouldn’t have all the documentation of our many emails and text messages to prove how above and beyond I went for him. This scammer did get a full refund but because of the documents I sent, PayPal covered my expenses. I have a feeling this guy is very familiar with ripping people off.

name: Betty McGillis
text: I've done a newborn workshop with Amy, she is a gifted prefessional..beyond talented.. I cannot thank her enough for sharing her gift with other newborn photographer's like myself. My business has thrived since doing the workshop, thank you Amy..

resp.text: Thank you so much Miss Betty!

name: JR S
text: I'm sure she'll send the National Reserve out to find me for writing what I endured. I tried contacting this photographer before my daughter was born and she never returned my phone call or writing via Facebook. I didn't like how I was treated- she acts like everyone else in this rotten town- treats people like money bags than a breathing and valuable human being.

resp.text: Congratulations on your new arrival but I don't think you actually tried contacting me.This is the strangest thing I've ever read! I'm sorry for what you've "endured" by me not replying to you. How can I treat you like anything if I never actually spoke to you?

name: Лена Леденцова
text: Very beautiful Job

name: Jeff Harper
text: Professional but personable service. Ken really cares about his craft and it shows.

name: Lashandra D
text: So I would have gave three stars but I called earlier Today to see if I could change my appointment to a later time and was told No. We arrived on time with about 5 mins to spare to walk in with two families still taking pictures and another family waiting ahead of us to take pictures. Our appointment time was at 6:30pm but we didn’t take pictures to until an hour later. If I was told when I called at 2:30 yes then it would’ve eliminated us sitting around for an hour. The time management or lack there of  was a big issue for me. When we did start taking pictures I think our photographer name was Josh, he was good. Our youngest just wasn’t getting it right but he worked with him. The furniture in the waiting area could use a shampoo. The bathrooms/dressing room was clean. With it being an portrait studio an additional mirror in the sitting area or hallway would be nice to make last minute adjustments.

name: Robert C
text:
I'm a seasoned portrait innovations customer, so here's an honest review. Most of the one star reviews below have to do with making an appointment, do yourself a favor and NEVER make an online appointment with them. Always call to make an appointment and make sure you request a specific photographer so you know you have a good one. We called today and made appointment with Amber at noon and when we showed up we got started immediately. We have made online appointments in the past and they never work out well; long waits, poor service. Amber has been great with our kids and she takes fantastic photos.

Also know going in you have to take like 100 photos, and it takes an hour to an hour and 1/2. this was very frustrating for me in the beginning especially if we only wanted one photo, but as long as you know beforehand you can plan for it.

As far as the facility goes, they have a play area for children, clean restrooms, great scene changes / props / background, and it's air-conditioned. If you're thinking to yourself you will just use competition in the area, there's not much. A lot of photographers want to take outdoor pictures which can be very hot and only one scene.

We bought a rather big package today and it was about $350.. Ouch! So lastly let's talk about pricing strategy. The cheapest way to go is get a single photo for about $20, which comes with about 35 prints (one pose). Not a bad deal and your pretty much guaranteed to get a great picture because you'll have like 100 to choose from. The catch is there's 100 professional photos of your family and you're bound to like more than one. So to get the most bang for your buck, I recommend the very first package that gets you all the digital prints. I believe it's the package with 6 poses + ALL the digital ones and it's around $70. Get home and post all those photos to Facebook and you'll know you made the right choice.

Once you pay, all your pictures are printed and ready to pick up in about 20 minutes. Same day service is a huge bonus! Specialty items however do take a few days (books, calendars, canvas).

Four stars because there are some real shortcomings here, however if you go in with a strategy, you will definitely end up with frame worthy pictures that will make you smile for a long time to come.

--> If you found this review helpful please give it a like!

name: Jeremiah Bradford
text: Love our pictures! The service was great even though they were short on staff the day of. However, the pricing was very expensive. We were not expecting to pay the amount we did with the number of  poses we chose. Besides the pricing being able to get printouts the same day was great! We would go back when they have a good sale or if we need a specific picture/print!

name: Heather Wilson
text: I made a mistake on the day of my appointment by going in at the time I thought it was.  Turns out my appointment was earlier that morning.  They still let me keep an appointment and fit me right on in.  I was very happy to be able to have my son's graduation picture made, and they looked great.  The staff was very nice and professional.

name: Deidra J
text: Got my daughters pictures taken with her cousin the man did not tell us that if we do the pictures together we can’t keep them. We wanted to get 2 of the 29.99 package with the canvas. Ended up losing all the pictures because of this except for 1. He also did not tell us that this package does not come with the online account to access the pictures. The pictures didn’t even look professional. It also does not state anywhere that when you get the canvas you have to pay for shipping of the canvas! They tell you that at the end! I will never go to portrait innovations again. There are plenty of local photographers with better backgrounds and better packages.

name: Bri Pena
text: We waited until an hour after our appointment time and they still had not taken us back. We ended up just leaving and not having our pictures done. We did not even receive an apology. Just don't waste your time!

name: Deedrik J 2015 Smith
text: Prompt. Great pictures. Good with kids. Prices are high but the pictures are too good to leave behind. Went to spend $14.99 for Valentine's Day special and spent $300. Yep, he got me good.

name: Manners 62
text: I took my family up for Christmas pictures. I booked online & expected a wait because of the holiday's....just not a 2 1/2 hours wait. There wasn't much seating due to the staff getting so behind. We were rushed during pictures and ultimately I chose the very bare minimum because I was so unsatisfied with how they came out. I would rate this a 1 star but since it was the holidays and I know how busy that time can get so I'm being understanding. They also print the pictures right there for you in less than 30 minutes so that's a bonus.

name: Jazzy Caprice
text: I didn't really like my experience at this location. I feel like they could have been better and more energetic. I have only used Portrait Innovation twice for my baby. The first time was in Pensacola and I had a great experience. Then this time I used the Montgomery location. They seemed frustrated and not so patient. My baby didn't do so well with those types of vibes. He has been getting pictures done since he was born and has always done great. The staff kept saying that they were short handed but that doesn't mean they couldn't be more friendly/upbeat!  People kept coming in talking about their pictures. Heck, I didn't even get greeted at first. Then the lady said the photographer will be back (I had an appointment) and then she just magically said she will take the pictures. By that time of waiting my baby had got hungry again. The girl there wasn't knowledgeable about the sales and the manager kept having to leave me to help her, he yawned the whole time while I picked my pictures and my book does not look great. It is full of pictures I didn't want in the book. I was just thinking maybe it was a bad day for them and I just paid for a bunch of pictures I didn't really like at all; I went back to pick up my child's book and it was the same vibes (low energy,not really concerned and feeling rushed). I actually got his Easter pictures redone with another company.

name: Jenn Pierre
text: I booked online for Christmas and was not prepared for the wait to be so long. We loved the photos we got and the photographers were very friendly. I only gave 3 stars because the company needs to change its method of booking appointments. If you have to wait 2-3 hours you may as well just take walk in appointments only.

text: I wish I could give a zero because this place doesn't deserve one star. We were on time still had to wait nearly an hour the photographer Amber was very rude and has no business working with small children she talk to my four year old granddaughter as if she was not a small child. I wish I had read these  reviews first I would never have come to this business. If you're looking for great customers service and a friendly atmosphere you better keep looking cause this not it . Just  rude for no reason. I want be back

text: Someone paid for my pictures for me but unbeknownst to me, they didn’t pay for them all so I began irate & started going off. That was until Joshua G. I’ll recommend him to everyone I know! Thanks Joshua G.

name: Cynthia Allen
text: We arrived for our appointment and had to wait for almost 2 hours to get our pictures taken. Then we had to wait to wait another 1 1/2 to go through our pictures and pick our package. If they know they are going to have large groups that take more time, they should book two appointment time slots for them. At one point there was 7 families waiting for either pictures or packaging. We only stayed because we were already late on getting the pictures done and we didn’t want to wait again the next weekend. I miss JCPenney Portraits!!

name: Meredith Duke
text: Let me start by saying that the pictures came out great! That is the ONLY reason why I am giving this place 3 stars. We have been here before. 5 years ago actually & our prior experience was wonderful. The Caucasian lady with short dirty blonde hair & glasses was extremely impatient & rude. I made a comment saying "I like this picture, but do not like the lighting but I like this one." Her reply, "Cameras have lights! That's normal." Her tone was very condescending. When we were doing our newborn photos we asked what other pose options we had as far as poses, backgrounds, seats, etc & her reply "You mean besides what all I've already done?" "NOTHING". I've never been treated like that before. I honestly wanted to leave, but since my mother in law was paying for the portraits I did not want to cause a fuss. I had my father in law & mother in law with me & my 2 children & we all felt the same way that she was very rude. We did ask for different poses, etc but in my opinion when you are spending your hard earned money somewhere then it's the businesses job to uphold at least a customer service professional attitude. That definitely was lost during our experience. They may have gotten money from our visit this time, but we will not be returning.

text: I am disgusted with my experience...I get it was holiday time, and they over booked to get sells from their promotions, but they are unprofessional when it comes to satisfying customers...they are short on staff, they watch you come in, and don't address you, they don't get to you in a timely manner, they talk reckless, they don't fully explain where the extra fees come from, they make you think you're getting a deal when you're really not, they make you go through the entire different packages which is time consuming when you yell them up front what you want, they scam you into paying more than what you intend to, etc...my order came with an ornament, and mug...they never called, nor sent an email to inform me when the products arrived; I go back to check to see if they arrive...had to wait forever, I was brushed off by 1 on the employees heading out of the door, and was approached with an attitude by the 1 who had to come assist me...she got smart asking if I received an email; I told her I didn't receive an email, but was told when it would arrive, she then saw that only the mug came in, and not the ornament...luckily I took a look at before departing the premises...both objects from what I had seen on display were extremely small as to why I cringed a bit, but not only that the quality of the photo on the mug was distorted...I sent my boyfriend back in to address the concern, but I had to go back in myself after I calmed down a bit to see what was being said, as I walk back in, the same girl that waited on me says well what's wrong with it; looking at the display, and my mug as if she didn't see what the issue was, then calls for backup, an Lord behold it's the one that took the pictures, who was giving the worst attitude to people the day of the shoot, and as the girl was telling her what the issue was, she was acting as if she was just over the whole situation, and the photographer was like yeah whomever took the photo cropped it to close..."well hello, it was you"...smh; I was asked to write down my contact, and address info so that the remake could be sent to my home...I have been calling the studio, and I can't get through...I still have received an email, or anything...at this point; I would just like a refund!!!!

name: MP3 STUDIO
text: To all of the men, women and children that have experienced a session at any Portrait Innovations, allow me to give you the run down of the operation. As a former employee of PI, I can honestly tell you that EVERY employee is aware of your issues and can DO NOTHING ABOUT IT. Yes.... they know that they are overbooked but they can't tell you they are or they'll lose their job. They are overbooked because half of the appointments are made from a call center. True...Its wrong but let's be real. If you have a large group, you can't possibly expect to walk in and out in 30 minutes.It takes that long to look at the pictures. Here's another something about the employees that most of you aren't aware of. Keeping their job is based on their SALES average which has to stay higher than $110. This is something to take into consideration when you only show up to spend $15. Please don't mistake that they do appreciate your business but having session after session spending only the bare minimum means their SALES AVERAGE is well below $110 and now they may not have a job next week. THINK ABOUT IT! How often have you stepped into one and seen a new face or your favorite photographer is gone. That would be why. Them trying to force pictures and products on you is them fighting to keep their jobs....That's the only reward that they get for selling $600 in photos. NO PRIZE.....NO PAT ON THE BACK....JUST  ANOTHER  STRESSFUL WEEK OF FIGHTING TO PAY YOUR BILLS. Yes... they can play with you kids, make them laugh, and get that perfect picture but believe me when  I say that they are stressed out. So please, coming from someone who has been in their shoes, be patient and understanding. They are just a small part of cooperate America... the little guys that take ALL of the blame but has no power to change any of it.

My mom asked when we would take our pictures and they said since the whole party wasn't there at the same time we were bumped to the bottom. EVEN THOUGH THEY WERE OVER BOOKED ! After waiting those 2 hours we finally got to take our pictures and I hated it. The photographer was not personal at all , she said turn this way turn that way do this do that. Not asking what I wanted or what I may like. She was very snappy pushy when we were picking our pictures. That was my first time there and I was lost she knew that and continued to talk fast like I knew everything. My pictures was for my birthday and my experience sucked. It put a damper on my day to be honest. From the looks of reviews the time situation is ridiculous and customer service needs major improvement. I wouldn't go back if you payed me.

My one star is for LaDaja.

RIP OFF. I purchased the $19.99 fall package with free canvas and was charged nearly DOUBLE because they make you pay their shipping costs. They no longer allow you to go back and purchase photos at a later date so, if you don't spend an additional $100+, they immediately delete your photos. You can't even purchase a CD!

As far as the operation of their business goes, the girl who took my sons photos was the most polite, patient, and helpful person there. We arrived on time and had to wait an hour past our appointment time with one studio clearly available for use. The manager was extremely rude to my pre-schooler after he came to show me the prop SHE let him play with. We were notified after leaving that "a couple" photos were left out of our package, it was really SEVEN PAGES of photos. Our pavket had been checked before leaving because someone else's photo cards were mixed into our pictures. After the 40 minute round trip back to the store for the pictures they left out, I wasn't offered so much as discounted session for their mistakes. The woman tried to hand me the packet and walk away. I informed her of my problem and all she had to say was "sorry". We won't be back.

I was really irritated because I live 45minutes away and would have to come back on a different day to pick up his pictures and that was the only reason why I chose them because part of their advertisement is same day pick up. When we walked in the studio they had about 5 other families in front of us, which irritated me even more because we were on time for my son’s appointment and when I asked the two ladies at the front desk why they were so behind and how long the wait was.  One lady pretended as if she didn’t hear me so I got louder so the other lady said an hour, which wasn’t true they were 2 hours late taking my son’s pictures and I was pissed by this time because I scheduled his appointment according to his sleep schedule and since they started so late he begin to cry because he was exhausted so we only got in a few good pictures. Their customer service was in very poor taste because even though they were not on time, they did not offer any type of discount to correct their mistake because a broken printer has nothing to do with your camera because they were still working so there was no reason they should have been 2 hours late taking my son’s pictures. Another thing, the props they use with the kids need to either be washed or thrown away and new ones need to be purchased because they looked gross. On top of that when I went back to get my son’s pictures they had ordered some of the wrong prints in the wrong sizes or not the correct prints at all so I still have to go somewhere else to have more pictures printed out which means I have to spend more money. name: Tina Butts
text: After using Joel on two occasions to do photos for me and my family, I booked a Maternity Session more than 3 months in advance. During that time, I texted him to gain an understanding of what the cost would be. He asked a few questions and then never got back with me. Since I had used him on 2 other occasions (most recently 9 months ago) and his prices were reasonable... and this session would be no more work than the previous sessions, I didn't press the issue and figured we would just discuss it later. Well..when I texted him a month before the event to confirm my date, he mentioned he noticed he had never responded to my text regarding the price.  After asking a few more questions he came back with a price of $800?!?!?!??? This is almost as much as I paid for my wedding pictures and they were ABSOLUTELY GORGEOUS with tons of editing (much better than any session that we had with Joel). I have spoken with several licensed photographers since this time and NONE of them charge anywhere near this high. Going price for this type of session was $150-450 for a 1-2 hr session and digital photos (Max). Unfortunately this put me in a real bind because now it was extremely hard to find another photographer that was available for my date. Joel mentioned he would come down to $550...but this was still higher than "average". This high pricing also was not in line with the pricing on his website. Although he did not have Maternity specifically listed, he had Engagement Sessions for the same length of time (2 hr session and digital photos) for $400 and this was synonymous to my requested session since it would be only me and my husband for a couple of hours. Given that he put me in such a stressful bind at an already stressful time in my life, I would definitely NOT recommend him. I tried to work out the pricing with him to be more reasonable and even explained my issue of having troubles finding someone else this late...but he was unwilling to work with me...even though he knew that it was his fault because he never answered my text regarding pricing 3+ months ago. Do yourself a favor...use someone who responds to text messages and honors pricing listed on their website. At a minimum,  select someone who is willing to take responsibility when they make a mistake...that unfortunately does not appear to be Joel at Yellowhammer. :(

resp.text: Thanks for taking the time to share your feedback. We have always enjoyed working with you and your family and are glad you were so pleased with our work in the past that you decided to reach out to us for your maternity session. While we strive to accommodate almost any budget, we understand that sometimes that does not work out. While we do offer lower-priced photography collections, those price points do not include the digital copies of edited photographs that you requested. We hope you were able to use one of the many photographers we recommended, who may be able to offer a lower price point. Thanks again for your business, and we wish you all the best in the future.

Most of my son’s shots are great and I would love to have some prints made but who in their right mind would pay those prices???? The “better” deal, yet still crazy expensive, is to get a package, but that’s such a waste. No one cares about 50+ wallet pictures. That’s silly. So why order something that you won’t use?!
So, I gave 2 stars only because the pictures themselves were great.... based on everything else, 1 star!!!! If they sell enough of those price-gouged prints they can afford to buy their own stars 😡

name: Shivani Patel
text: Due to lockdown my first born twins couldn’t get their pictures done, I mentioned that to Ms. Rowlen plenty of times. We got our boys six months photoshoot done with her including my husband, our fur baby and I. She neither guided us for any poses nor I got a single picture of my boys. Without even looking at our pictures, I paid money in full as I understand we all are struggling at this times. I even requested her if we can get us in again for the boys pictures again yet she hasn’t responded. I couldn’t send out my family any holiday pictures as there aren’t any pictures of them alone. Very disappointed with her service. My husband who never finds a fault in any person, made a comment about her being a lazy photographer. I hate to write a bad comment about anyone but this was so special to me for being the first time mom. I wish she would’ve understood that and worked with us with ideas and suggestions. Also I clearly mentioned to her that I’m trying to her pictures done in Beautiful Alabama Fall Foliage but that didn’t happen as well. 😭😭😭

resp.text: I have emails and messages to show where Ms. Upadhyay was told the time her session started, how long it would be, the fact most areas were still green but might be changed by her desired session date, (she had a specific timeframe she wanted and didn't want to wait) as well as the fact it was better if the children sat up for the session. She insisted on wanting them asap and then sent me a photo of the twins sitting up. Then at the session, that they arrived late for they took awhile getting kids dressed, mom getting her shoes on etc.. she told me they could NOT sit up. So I explained to her and her husband that the children had to be leaned against them or they had to be holding them and I would focus on just the child. I will NOT take photos of ANY child and put them in harms way just to get a shot. They both were told this and I still took photos of just the boys together as well as each individual child with their parents holding them. So I am not sure why she is saying she didn't get a single picture of the boys.  I directed them in every pose and even asked if they wanted different ones where she indeed asked for extra poses and we did them. They went well over their scheduled shooting time of 45 minutes, as I had a babysitter and know how much I paid them and I checked my camera data to see the exact shooting time. I never once rushed them and stayed longer, even though they were late cause I knew she wasn't happy. She complained the entire time that the boys wouldn't smile and I tried, she tried and dad tried, the boys wouldn't have it. (kids will be kids this happens often with my own kids too) She has beautiful images of her family and she downloaded them all before she complained to me. As stated on my website I can not guarantee children will smile or be able to do any specific poses as kids will do what they want to do. I asked at the session if they had any other things they wanted to do after I was done with my poses and she said yes, I did them and then we were done. Not once did she mention she didn't like the location or any poses I suggested or did at the session. I feel I was far from lazy accommodating their wants and needs as well as making sure not only her twins were looking her dog was as well. I do my best but again can not guarantee smiles, I wish I could.. but in this case even mom and dad couldn't get the littles to smile. :(

text: Meredith is an excellent photographer and always does an amazing job. She has done family pictures for us for many years and also did our wedding photography. name: Monica S.
text:
I was extremely disappointed by my experience.

I told the photographer it would be our first time shooting as a family and asked for any tips prior and told her this was primarily for family photos to use as a Christmas card. The only tip told ahead of time was: not to wear totally matching outfits, but ones that coordinate.

At the shoot, it was cold, so
I understand it wasn’t the most ideal environment, but the photographer seemed checked out.

We got a mix of photos that were heavily edited, and in my opinion, poorly edited (overly whited out) and mostly solo pictures of the baby. (I am a snap happy mom so I have many pictures of the baby solo, and not many of the family as a whole—which I mentioned during the shoot).

I was really disappointed by the emailed gallery, conveyed such, and asked for maybe even the unedited copies of the photos
(I respect the time it takes to edit the photos).
When requesting the unedited copies, even offering to pay more, I was denied even though I was really disappointed by the edited results.

Most of all, I found photos of my child online without consent or request. Totally horrified. This was never mentioned (nor was permission asked). I only found them after looking for a place to read other reviews to see if I was the only person not happy with the results of this particular photographer.

Edit: I’ve spoken to more photographers in the area for future sessions and mentioned my experience, and they noted that they would have offered to re-edit them or have given the unedited photos (for free, and especially for an additional fee).

resp.text: Sorry that you were unhappy with your experience. We both have completely different opinions to how this all went down and I'm not going to argue each one of your comments above with you. Your son was precious and it was nice to meet you guys, I wish you the best in future portrait sessions.

text:
35 sitting fee, ok, but unprofessional assistant and very disorganized isn’t a good thing, with the assistance of the younger person I ordered the economy package, a few weeks later I received a email stating ready, so went in and they weren’t the lady apologized, so a few weeks later went in, gave my name etc, the older person couldn’t find my photos asked me numerous times what name would they be under, and even if I was sure I didn’t pick them up, she went on to give excuses that she was out all month over COVID, so I made sure my hands were clean and my-mask stayed on, anyway she got on the phone chatted with whom I have no idea then stated I found them let me all you back after I get these to her and she leaves, ok well she handed me some wallets, I’m like really? This isn’t what I ordered, she is yes they are! No woman I know what I ordered I ordered while talking to an employee who told me which to click and pay, ok, I’m like just refund my money, a second later the photographer came up, asked if they made a mistake, I’m like yes, I was suppose to get the economy 8x10 2 5x7 and a few wallets, ok, I’m like I need these I’m leavin* for SC and he said they’ll be ready this after noon, the woman cuts in, were closed at 5 I’m like np I don’t live far I’ll be here, we’re I barely returned home and sat down received a call they’re ready, hmm that fast, no drying time, so I went in, arrived at the desk was told here, so I looked at them nothing really saying they were high quality, in fact they were sticky to the touch, when I stated this the woman replies have a good day and walked away, hmm, ok son looked at them and even sticky to him so he laid them out, well I posted on FB my experience and the photographer responded I’ll call you in the morning, I’m like ok, we’ll sitting in my drs office he called, I informed him of the stickiness and how I felt about this experience and not even getting a apology, we’ll bring in I’ll redo I’m like I have no time, I’m being rushed as it is trying  to get packed up for the trip, one wax a gift to my sons grandmother he placed in the frame the next day and wrapped, I told my son to unwrap so we could return and behold it’s stuck to the frame, now I’m getting text after text come in I’ll replace do this return I’m like dude I’ve been there wasted my gas and want me to keep coming in?
I called a trusted photographer who told me he should of let them dry and that with that experience he would of just refunded and offered to retake.
I the last text was trying to make the stickiness my fault over using hand sanitizer, I’m like wrong answer my hands were dried off and I didn’t use it the second time, look ppl might have good things to say but I do not, heck Walmart prints better photos then this, and trust I’ll not go back..

name: Richard Schlinkert
text: I took in about thirty 35mm slides to transfer to digital, and while they turned the order around quickly, the slides had dust and lint in them and were very low resolution for the cost, which is about twice what the mail-in services charge for twice the resolution.  Unless you are in a hurry, look elsewhere

resp.text:
Thank you for sharing your experience with us.  We're sorry that the final results of your scanning order did not meet your expectations.  We pride ourselves on giving each order personal attention and all of the work we do is done in our Birmingham location (in the historic Avondale neighborhood).
We recall your order very clearly.  You chose our PROOF quality (700 ppi) for your slide scanning order, which our lowest resolution (and lowest priced).  We also offer ARCHIVE quality scans (1700 ppi) at a slighlty higher cost.  Our scanning service, whether Proof or Archive level, includes the utilization of dust removal software, which can remove superficial debris and blemishes on the scanned images.
Our technician specifically noted the high concentration of dust on your slides before scanning your slides.  Prior to scanning your order, our tech  attempted to manually clean each of your slides by hand to remove the dust and lint you described.  Unfortunately, dust and lint are often stuck to the film itself and may not be removed except by rewashing or physically wiping the film with a chemical solution.
We are generally unwilling to do such aggressive cleaning, out of fear we might damage our clients irreplaceable originals.  More often, if the condition of the originals is so bad that our usual cleaning and post-production are insufficient, we can do restorastion to the scanned images.  This digital retouching is not inexpensive, but for extremely valuable or badly deteriorated images, it is often the best option.
Again, we're sorry to hear you were not completely satisfied with our service.  We would welcome the opportunity to regain your confidence.

name: Donna Davis
text:
Wow.  As grandparents, we received a link to see the photographs of our granddaughter.  The price list was so blurry that we could not read it and it was not on the website.  The pictures of our newborn granddaughter were on a very busy, multi colored quilt which did not highlight our granddaughter.  We selected a photograph from the limited selection that we wanted to purchase for our home.  After meeting and looking over the photographs, we called for pricing.  "Lisa" who answered the telephone was asked for pricing.  She inquired how we were related to the baby and stated that they were not trying to 'hide" the pricing.  I told her the price list was blurry and we did not infer that they were hiding anything.  We told her that we were interested in one photograph to which she grumbled "only one" and asked what size.  I told her that we would like to see a price list but we only have 45 minutes left to order due to the deadline.  She curtly stated that we had "one week" to call or decide on an order.  Unfortunately, it took us this long with our work schedules to take time to call about the price list and have everything ready to place an order.  However, we were still within our allotted time frame.   We told her that we were interested in pricing on an 8x10 or larger since we were not sure what sizes they offered at this studio.  She barked out the prices for an 8x10 and a 5x7 then demanding to know what we wanted to order.  I told her that we would hire our own photographer rather than order from her since she did not sound like she wanted to me a sale.  Sadly, we did not order from this studio due to the unprofessional staff on the telephone.  My husband asked who we had spoken to so I called back and asked "Lisa" if there was someone else or a manager that we could speak to and she replied that she was "the owner".  I thanked her and hung up.  She was snickering, barking, and making other annoying sounds during the conversation to which the children in the car commented how rude and nasty she was in both phone calls.
Apparently, this studio does not need our business or yours since the "owner" can rudely talk to customers who want to order even one photograph.  We were looking to order a large 16x20 or 24x36 photograph of our granddaughter but we could not get information on the larger sizes when calling to inquire over the phone.
The photographs were not tasteful, nor well laid out to compliment a baby.  If you are looking for artist, skilled photographs it would suit you to look further than this studio/photographer.  Walmart would be able to offer you same level of artistry with better customer service.
